Interface ILifeModel

All Known Implementing Classes:
LifeModel
public interface ILifeModel

Method Summary
 void clearCells()
          sets all cells to off
 void drawOnCanvas(Graphics2D g)
          contains code to draw the canvas correctly you'll probably want to use the Graphics2D fillRect() method
 int getCanvasHeight()
          returns the correct height of the Life canvas
 int getCanvasWidth()
          returns the correct width of the Life canvas
 void handleClick(int x, int y)
          given the x and y coordinate where a user clicked, changes the state of the correct cell.
 void printToFile(PrintStream out)
          prints a text file from which the current state can be determined.
 void readFromScanner(Scanner in)
          reads a text file in the form given by printToFile and sets the state of this model appropriately
 void setIsScreenWrapped(boolean isScreenWrapped)
          determines whether the screen is considered "wrapped", i.e.
 void step()
          changes the state of the model to the next state off cells with exactly three on neighbors turn on on cells with exactly two or three neighbors stay on all other cells end up off
 

Method Detail

clearCells

void clearCells()
sets all cells to off

drawOnCanvas

void drawOnCanvas(Graphics2D g)
contains code to draw the canvas correctly you'll probably want to use the Graphics2D fillRect() method

getCanvasHeight

int getCanvasHeight()
returns the correct height of the Life canvas

getCanvasWidth

int getCanvasWidth()
returns the correct width of the Life canvas

handleClick

void handleClick(int x,
                 int y)
given the x and y coordinate where a user clicked, changes the state of the correct cell. If it was on, change it to off, if off, change to on.

printToFile

void printToFile(PrintStream out)
prints a text file from which the current state can be determined. The format is +-------------------+ |rows cols cellSize | |r1 c1 | |r2 c2 | |... | |rn cn | | | +-------------------+ where each cell at row r and column c is on for each of the r's and c's

readFromScanner

void readFromScanner(Scanner in)
reads a text file in the form given by printToFile and sets the state of this model appropriately

setIsScreenWrapped

void setIsScreenWrapped(boolean isScreenWrapped)
determines whether the screen is considered "wrapped", i.e. if the top row considers the bottom row a neighbor and the left-most row considers the right-most a neighbor and vice versa

step

void step()
changes the state of the model to the next state off cells with exactly three on neighbors turn on on cells with exactly two or three neighbors stay on all other cells end up off
